title: Biden's secretary of state outlines new foreign policy
description: CNN's Wolf Blitzer speaks with Secretary of State Antony Blinken about how President Joe Biden's foreign policy differs from former President Trump's and what Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny's arrest means for US-Russia relations.

title: George Conway discusses Trump's trial arguments
description: Conservative attorney and Trump critic George Conway discusses the arguments presented for former President Trump on the eve of his second impeachment trial.

title: WHO says vaccine data 'needs more study'
description: Dr Matshidiso Moeti, W.H.O regional director for Africa, and Angus Thomson of UNICEF, discuss the study on the AstraZeneca vaccine's efficacy against the South Africa variant.

title: Fans rally around Britney Spears after documentary
description: Fans are showing their support for Britney Spears after the release of a New York Times documentary titled "Framing Britney Spears."

title: Watch Kylie Jenner do Caitlyn Jenner's makeup for the first time
description: Kylie Jenner got deep with Caitlyn Jenner about her transition in a makeover video posted on YouTube.

title: Adorable video shows Amy Schumer's son watching his mom on TV
description: Comedian Amy Schumer shared an adorable video of her 1-year-old son, Gene, watching her on TV in a Super Bowl commercial.

title: 'Skinniest house' is on sale for $1.3 million
description: A house billed as "possibly the skinniest house in London" is up for sale for £950,000 ($1.3 million).

title: Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes agree one-year deal with joint commitment for 'greater diversity and inclusion'
description: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton will continue to race for Mercedes in the 2021 season after agreeing a new, one-year deal, the team announced on Monday.

title: Highlights and lowlights of the Super Bowl TV show
'It's a miracle,' Dutch officials say as stowaway survives London to Holland flight in freezing temperatures
description: A 16-year-old Kenyan boy has survived sub-zero temperatures on an hour-long flight from London to the Netherlands by hiding himself near the plane's landing gear.

title: Seniors are having trouble getting Covid-19 vaccines. These cousins set up a system to help
description: Cousins Jacqueline Teague and Amelie Beck are juggling hybrid learning, extracurricular activities and now a volunteer project helping seniors in Kentucky get Covid-19 vaccine appointments.

title: This woman used Gorilla Glue instead of hair spray. She ended up in the hospital
description: A Louisiana woman has sought medical treatment after mistakenly using Gorilla Glue spray adhesive in place of actual hair spray.

title: 'The best ever in all sports': Tom Brady's GOAT status captures world's imagination
description: LeBron James or Michael Jordan? Roger Federer or Rafa Nadal? Lionel Messi or Cristiano Ronaldo? The argument over who's the greatest of all time in many sports is fiercely contested.

title: Morgan Wallen's record sales skyrocket after racial slur controversy
description: Radio and others may have dropped him, but Morgan Wallen's music is still selling.

title: Trump's team is making defense he wanted peace. CNN rolls the tape
description: CNN's John Avlon analyzes a defense argument made by former President Donald Trump's legal team as he faces a second impeachment trial.

title: Tesla says you could soon pay for one of its cars with bitcoins
description: Tesla is betting big on bitcoin, saying it may soon accept the digital currency as payment for its cars. And the most valuable car company on the stock market said it is holding some of its cash in bitcoins rather than traditional currency.

title: 12 lifestyle habits to reduce stress during a pandemic
description: People have been living in a storm of stress during the ongoing pandemic and political turmoil, which has had a negative impact on our well-being.

title: Jack Ma is swapping drawings with his biggest fan
description: Two of Asia's biggest names in tech, Masayoshi Son and Jack Ma, are keeping in touch through personal drawings.

title: India glacier burst: Rescue workers looking for scores of people feared dead
description: At least 180 people are missing and 14 have died in northern India after part of a Himalayan glacier fell into a river sending a devastating avalanche of water, dust and rocks down a mountain gorge, and crashing though a dam.

title: Brooks Koepka claims his first win since 2019
description: It's been a long time coming, but finally Brooks Koepka is a winner again.

title: Why Trump won't be testifying at impeachment trial
Global oil prices have fully recovered from the pandemic
description: After a rocky 12 months, oil prices — which got crushed when Covid-19 slashed demand for energy around the world — are roaring back.

title: She built a simpler vaccine site for her state ... while on maternity leave
description: Olivia Adams, a software developer who works for a healthcare company, took it upon herself to build a simpler website for her state that shows available vaccine appointments in Massachusetts.

title: The ex-President faces a second impeachment trial over a historic insurrection and an attempt to steal an election that wounded US democracy
description: In a momentous week, America confronts a new reckoning with the negligent, destructive legacy of Donald Trump.

title: These blue beads found in Alaska may be the first European items in North America
description: Christopher Columbus may have sailed the ocean blue in 1492, but some tiny blue beads beat him to it, reaching North America a few decades sooner, to become possibly the earliest European-made objects on the continent.

title: Williams sisters make dream start to Australian Open
description: The Williams sisters rolled back the years on Monday as both stormed to straight-set victories in the Australian Open first round.

title: This riot footage could be problematic for Trump
description: Democrats argue that former President Donald Trump incited the Capitol riot with his rhetoric. This video from the insurrection may help them make their case.

title: What it was like spending a week alone on a Swedish island
description: Swedish nurse Lisa Enroth won a contest to spend seven days watching movies from Göteborg Film Festival's on an isolated, windswept lighthouse island. Here's what happened after the boat left her all alone.

title: The coronvirus pandemic is still going strong. But there's hope on the horizon
description: Despite a year of pandemic-driven social isolation and pain, in which we lost hundreds of thousands of lives, there are encouraging signs on the horizon.

title: Chevron may not be an oil-first company in 2040, CEO says
description: Chevron has built a $170 billion fossil fuels empire that has made the 141-year-old company synonymous with the oil-and-gas industry.

title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic scores 500th goal of club career in AC Milan victory
description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic continues to defy the aging process as the 39-year-old striker scored the 500th and 501st goals of his club career in AC Milan's Serie A win over Crotone on Sunday.

title: After weeks of drama and setbacks, the Australian Open kicks off
description: Thousands of tennis fans descended on Melbourne Park to watch stars including Naomi Osaka and Serena Williams kick off the Australian Open on Monday, after a three-week postponement and high drama over the quarantine of players.

title: CNN speaks with Biden's Press Secretary Jen Psaki
description: CNN's Sunlen Serfaty sits down for an exclusive interview with White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki after her first weeks in the role for the Biden administration.

title: Heartbreak and anger as China discourages travel for Lunar New Year
description: Normally at this time of year, hundreds of millions of Chinese people would be packing highways, trains and planes on homebound trips to celebrate the Lunar New Year with their family.

title: Inside Malawi's Covid-19 wards, the impact of vaccine nationalism is all too clear
description: Even before Andrew Simbota arrived at the small, rural Mulanje district hospital on Saturday afternoon, doctors here wondered how they would treat him. They were down to two oxygen tanks for their entire Covid-19 ward. A serious patient like Simbota can use up to three canisters of high-flow oxygen a day.

title: How blockchain could make fashion greener
description: Fashion brands are increasingly keen to tout their green credentials, but with clothes production often involving complex global supply chains they can't always guarantee environmentally friendly materials are being used.

title: Martian moon Phobos could tell us what Mars was like in the past
description: Mars has long been a point of fascination for scientists as they try to uncover the planet's past and determine if it ever supported life.

title: China arrests Australian TV host on suspicion of spying
description: An Australian employee of China's state broadcaster CGTN has been arrested on suspicion of "illegally supplying state secrets overseas," Canberra said Monday.

title: ESPN reporter Pedro Gomez has died at 58
description: Longtime ESPN reporter Pedro Gomez died "unexpectedly" Sunday at the age of 58, according to a statement from ESPN and Sports Content Chairman James Pitaro.

title: The Weeknd's signature red Super Bowl jacket was his most elaborate yet
description: It was no surprise to see The Weeknd wearing one of his signature red jackets over an otherwise all-black ensemble during the Super Bowl halftime show. After all, the singer has regularly sported the look since releasing his 2020 album "After Hours."

title: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pleads not guilty to corruption charges
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has told a Jerusalem court he is not guilty of one charge of bribery and three charges of fraud and breach of trust.

title: Second drug kingpin arrested in Thailand tightening dragnet on huge syndicate
description: A second senior leader of a vast drug syndicate has been arrested, a Thai narcotics official said, as a transnational dragnet tightens on the Sam Gor group, which police say dominates the $70 billion annual Asia Pacific drug trade.

title: School custodian sinks backwards half-court shot
description: Video of Joe Orians, a custodian at Liberty-Benton Local Schools in Ohio, shooting a backhand basketball shot sparked an overwhelming amount of positive reactions.

title: Ariana Grande just earned her 20th Guinness World Records title
description: Ariana Grande keeps breaking records.

title: Read inaugural poet Amanda Gorman's Super Bowl poem
description: For Amanda Gorman, Inauguration Day was just the beginning. Now, she can cross the Super Bowl off her bucket list, too.
